Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: A, B, or E.<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? Choices:  A: shoes B: wet ground C: wet clothes D: start to fall E: water garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>D. Start to fall.<n><n>## Explanation:<n>- [x] Mara has 110 / 2= <<110/1=55>>56 cards since brenda has 9 cards more.<n>The total in all is 56+46+55= <<56+46=201>>201<n>- [x] the 46 is the one that janet has more than brenda<n>- [x] start to fall is because when it rains the floor or the ground is wet and when there are wet clothes and shoes you can't fall if you walk barefooted.<n>---<n><n>### Output:  Janet has 98 cards more than Brenda and Mara has twice as much as Brenda. How many cards do you have in all if Brenda has 40 fewer then 150?  <444444/44/<n><n>### Input<n>- [x] Janet has _98_ cards more than Brenda <B>B>Brenda<<n>- [x] Choice is 98 cards more.<n>- [x] Brenda has 98+98= <<98+98+98>>98 cards,<n>- [x] The amount is 98-98=<<98-98>>98* -98 = <<98 * 98>>- 98<n>- []<n>The number is 98* - 98=98*3.<n>The total is (98*3)+98+98 = 98+99+98 = <<99+98>><99>+98.= <n>- [x]<n>```<n><n>### Response<n>The response answer is <n>276<n><n>## Explanations:<n>- [x ] <n><n>### Input :  Mara has twice as may cards as Janet, and three times as many as brenda. How many cards does she have in all?<n><n>- [x ] Mara has a lot of cards.<n>- [x ] She has 250 cards.<n>- [ ]<n>She has 220+220+250 = <<220+219

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:What is a student about to do if they are sitting in front of a number of black and white keys? Choices:  A: talk B: read book C: play piano D: study book E: study engineering<n><n>### Response:		What is a teacher about to do if he/she has a number of black and green keys?<n><n>### Rationales: The teacher is having his/her students play the piano.<n><n>#### 1. A<n><n>#### 2. B<n><n>#### 3. C<n><n>#### 4. D<n><n>#### 5. E<n><n>##### 1. A<n>Answer: 161<n><n>##### 2. B<n>Answer: 197<n><n>##### 3. C<n>Answer: 9<n><n>##### 4. D<n>Answer: 13<n><n>##### 5. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:What should the bean bag chair sit on? Use 1-2 sentences to respond to each.<n><n>### Question 1:<n>What else do you need to know about the topic to answer the question below?<n><n>### Question:<n>If Xenon has 9 cards more or less than Pheobe, how many cards do they have altogether?<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>X + 9 = <<X+9=10>>10 cards if Phoebe has 10 cards more than xenon.<n><n>10/2= <<10/2= 5>>5 cards if Phoebe  has twice as many cards than Xenon<n><n>Therefore, Xenon has 25 - 5 = <<25-5= 20>>20 + 10 = 30 cards and Phoebe has 40 - 5= <<40-5= 35>>35 + 20 =55 cards altogether.<n><n>#### 55<n><n>The answer is D.<n><n>### Input <n>Where did the giraffes escape from? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:Billy's mother tripped over a stuffed animal.  She yelled at him not to leave his things where? Choices:  A: toy store B: hall C: bathroom D: amusement park E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration:Input: Billy's mother tripped on his stuffed animal. She yelled with him. Choices: bathroom, hall.<n>Rationales:His stuffed animals are left in the hallway so she tripped in the hall.<n><n>### Input:"Why is it called a vacuum cleaner?"<n><n>### Response:"Because it's not a broom.  That's not a good vacuum cleaner."<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### <n><n>### Input "If two trains met, it would take less time to pass than wait for the signal to change."<n><n>### Response Answer the following multiple choice question in a complete sentence.<n><n>### Reason: This would take just as much time as the signal. It takes one minute to pass each train since two trains can't occupy the same track. 2x2x2(twox) = 4 minutes.<n><n>### Answer "no signal"<n><n>### Rationales: It's quicker to pass the trains, so the trains' signal won't matter.<n><n>### 2x2x1(twoxx)<n><n>### 1 minute each train.<n><n>### To take less time than it takes to change the signal would mean that there would be no signal at all.<n><n>### If the signal doesn't change, it takes one minute to pass the first train. It also takes one minute to pass by the next train, so it takes two minutes to pass both.<n><n>### Signal would only take one minute to stop.<n><n>### It's the same as waiting for a green light at home.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:What do you feel from playing football? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: pain C: death D: getting hurt E: get hurt<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>Janet has 9 cards less than Samantha who has many cards. Mara has one and a half times as many cards as Jan. What  do they have in all?<n><n>### Response<n>Mara has 1 and a half times as much as Jan because Janet has 90 cards while Mara has (1.5 x 90) = <<1.5x90=135>>135 cards.<n>Samantha has (90/135) = <<90/1335=0.066>>0.066 cards since Janet had 9 cards less than her.<n>1+0.066 + 0.066 = <<1+0.07=1.7>>1.7 cards. Therefore, Samanth has 50/3 = <<50/3=16.6666667>>16.667 + 9 + 1.42857142857 = <<9.01081>19.028571>>19.0365 cards and 1.7 + 9.036 + 9 = <<1.7+9.036+9=18.5>>18.054 cards.<n>Therefore, Janet has 9.03+16.6 = <<16.6+16.6+9.03>22.4>>22.4 cards and Mara has 19.054. Therefore, they have 6 + (1.333333) = <<1.333>49>>49 cards.<n><n>### Input Janine is playing soccer and she loves it. However, she doesn't get injured much and thus she is safe. She runs into the goal and has to get out to prevent the opponents from scoring. She is hurt and gets a score. What do you feel from playing soccer? Choices: 1: exhilaration  2: love, 3: feeling 4: hate,      5: pain,            6: feeling terrible.<n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n>

So, How many shoes do I have in all? <n>- 3,4,5,6,7,8<n>- So, how many shoes do I own in all?<n><n>### Input   : You have 3 bananas and 12 apples. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:Always wash your hands before eating, you don't want to get germs onto food and inside your what? Choices:  A: water B: doctor C: spread disease D: mouth E: ear<n><n>### Response:		<n>I always wash my hands before eating, as I don't want to risk catching any diseases. This will also help keep my spread of germs low and can prevent my food from getting contaminated. However, you should still wash your dishes to remove spread of germs from previous meals. Your mouth.<n><n>###  A: water<n><n>###  B: doctor<n><n>

Choices: Choices:  A. 3 B. 22 C. 1 D. 11 E. 23<n><n>### Response<n>Choices:<n>- A <n>- B<n>- D <n>- E<n>- C<n><n>### Example/Example2:<n>The value of -23 is -23.<n>The value of +21 is 21.<n>The result of -23 +21 is (-23) + 21 = 22.<n>-23.31<n><n>**#1:33**<n><n>### Answer/Answer2:<n>The value is **33**<n><n>#### 33<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Input3:<n>How many is a 2-digit number in addition to 144? Choices: Choice: A _B_ C D E E - 3<n><n>### Example3:<n>If the 3 digit number has a value of 144, we use addition to get 3(144) = 3 + 144 = 147<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: 151<n><n>### Instructions:<n>* Input: A company must hire at least 200 employees. Increase

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>### Input:It was breakfast time.  Brad ordered eggs, toast, and something to drink. What might he drink? Choices:  A: coffee B: throw up C: food D: getting drunk E: wine<n><n>### Response:		<n>###### Explanation:<n>Brad ordered eggs, toast and something to drink. He might have ordered wine. Wine is something to drink. He'd get drunk (the correct answer).<n>
